intro: Paramignya angulata, commonly known as the angular paramignya, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its angular, ribbed stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
